response.overview: At the dawn of telecommunications, within every last sketchy business partnership, there was always a Tim "The Tool Man" Taylor. An impulsive, self-centered try-hard who, despite his crafted every-man image, suspiciously felt most comfortable in a necktie. And there was always an Al Borland, a mature, highly proficient, even-handed, and counterbalancing figure whose identity was as effortless as your favorite flannel shirt. Strangely, they often needed one another, and sometimes even liked one another. But in the end, in every case, there was a winner and a loser.
response.title: Fool Time
